headline.main: SUPPLY OF GROWTH HORMONE BRINGS HOPE FOR NEW USES

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: HUMAN growth hormone, long available in minuscule amounts to help abnormally short children reach normal adult height, is finally being produced in mass quantities by genetic engineering techniques, opening the door to a wealth of potential new medical uses. But experts fear that plentiful supplies may also encourage abuse - that practitioners of ''cosmetic endocrinology'' will use the hormone to increase athletic prowess or to increase the height of children in the belief it will improve their social and economic prospects.
